intro: Taraxacum duplex, commonly known as the double dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of pale green, hairy leaves and a flowering stem that bears a single, composite flower head. The flower head consists of both yellow ray florets and disk florets, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in meadows and grassy areas. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its resilience to environmental stress.
